resources.string: Can\'t compute area of self-intersecting polygon.
Please measure the length of the line below as precisely as possible.
Manual calibration does not eliminate inaccuracies due to rounding. Do not use this app as a professionally calibrated measuring device.
Please input the length of the line.
You can manually calibrate the ruler via the "calibrate" option in the action menu.
This app is not a professionally calibrated measuring device. Technische Universität Darmstadt is not liable for any damage caused by use of this app.
Privacy Friendly Ruler does not use any permissions.
You can display a cm ruler, an inch ruler or no ruler on the left and on the right side of the screen. Both rulers can be set separately in the option menu.
You can display an angle measure in degrees or radian on the left side of the screen.
The Privacy Friendly Ruler App turns Your Phone into a ruler for quick on the fly measurements.

You can choose to take a picture with the camera or use one from the gallery. Be sure that all the relevant objects are in the same plane and the picture is taken perpendicularly to that plane. Choose the desired reference object from the menu on the tor right, place the green shape over the reference object in the picture and press the button in the bottom right. Now you can choose the thing to measure via the button on the bottom right. You can measure length of lines and areas of triangles, circles and tetragons.
This application belongs to the group of Privacy Friendly Apps developed by Technische Universität Darmstadt. Sourcecode licensed under GPLv3. Images copyright TU Darmstadt and Google Inc.
More information can be found on:
What should be displayed on left ruler?
What should be displayed on right ruler?
Turn on scale for angle measuring?
What units of measurement to use in the screen ruler?
What reference object types to use?
Disable reference object categoreis you don\'t want to use.
This App is not a professionally calibrated measuring device. This App can be manually calibrated which may minimize the error. However, depending on the device there still could be rounding errors.
I have read the disclaimer about potential rounding issues.
Please check that you have read the disclaimer.
With Privacy Friendly Camera Ruler you can measure objects larger than your phone by taking a picture of them together with a reference object of known size, like a coin.
You can choose to take a picture with the camera or use one from the gallery. Be sure that all the relevant objects are in the same plane and the picture is taken perpendicularly to that plane.

Choose the desired reference object from the menu on the tor right, place the green shape over the reference object in the picture and press the button in the bottom right. Now you can choose the thing to measure via the button on the bottom right. You can measure length of lines and areas of triangles, circles and tetragons.
You can set the units of measurements to be used in the screen ruler.
You can disable certain types of predefined reference objects. They won\'t show up in the menu during reference object choice.
Here you can define and manage user defined reference objects (up to 10).
Get a picture to measure. You can either take a picture with your camera or use a picture from your phones memory.
